I see White has just played **f1g1**, moving their king to g1. It’s my turn as Black. The most pressing concern is White’s queen on d8, which is eyeing the d-file and threatening a discovered attack if White plays a rook or queen along the d-file. My rook on d8 is already defending the file, but I also want to keep an eye on potential checks.

Currently, my bishop on b4 is under attack by White’s pawn on d4. I need to decide how to respond to that. My bishop can retreat along the long diagonal. Let me consider moving it to a safe square: [b4a5], [b4c5], or [b4a3] all seem possible. Among these, [b4a3] puts more pressure on White’s queenside pawns and keeps the bishop active, so I’ll go with [b4a3].
